means: 使人尴尬的，令人为难的
（使）窘迫，（使）局促不安( embarrass的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: In an embarrassing climb-down, the Home Secretary lifted the deportation threat.
sentence.Network_cn: 内务大臣尴尬地作出让步，解除了将其驱逐出境的威胁。

sentence.Network_en: I had one of my most embarrassing moments in panto in Nottingham.
sentence.Network_cn: 在诺丁汉我经历了自己在童话剧演出中最尴尬的时刻之一。

sentence.Network_en: His people came up with a load of embarrassing information.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的部下亮出一大堆令人尴尬的资料来。

作_互动百科 ... 【feel embarrassed;feel awkward】 为难;受窘 【make things difficult for sb.】 阻挠;刁难.
不好意思的英语是什么？ - 已解决 -... ... Embarrassed Interview 喜来登面试 be embarrassed 受窘 feel embarrassed 感觉尴尬.

entry.tran: 令人害羞的;让人难堪的;令人尴尬的
entry.def: Something that is embarrassing makes you feel shy or ashamed.

example.ex: That was an embarrassing situation for me...
Men find it embarrassing to be honest.
example.tran: 实话实说让男人觉得难为情。

entry.def: Something that is embarrassing to a public figure such as a politician or an organization such as a political party causes problems for them.

example.ex: He has put the Bonn government in an embarrassing position...
example.tran: 他将波恩政府置于窘地。

example.ex: The speech was deeply embarrassing to Cabinet ministers.
example.tran: 这席话让内阁大臣们非常难堪。

means.word_mean: 1. hard to deal with; especially causing pain or embarrassment;

sentences.sentence: "awkward (or embarrassing or difficult) moments in the discussion"
"in the unenviable position of resorting to an act he had planned to save for the climax of the campaign"

means.word_mean: 2. causing to feel shame or chagrin or vexation;

sentences.sentence: "the embarrassing moment when she found her petticoat down around her ankles"
"it was mortifying to know he had heard every word"

auth_sentence.content: The line suffered an embarrassing embankment collapse last week.
auth_sentence.res_content: The line suffered an embarrassing embankment collapse last week.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The line suffered an embarrassing embankment collapse last week.

auth_sentence.content: But really, Washington Post, this is embarrassing.
auth_sentence.res_content: But really, Washington Post, this is embarrassing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But really, Washington Post, this is embarrassing.

auth_sentence.content: We had such a riot it was almost embarrassing.
auth_sentence.res_content: We had such a riot it was almost embarrassing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We had such a riot it was almost embarrassing.

Sentence.sentence: Substitutions of one gesture for the other often create not only humorous but also embarrassing moment.
Many embarrassing situations could be avoided.

means.word_mean: 使人尴尬的，令人为难的，使人害羞的（或难堪的、惭愧的）

sentences.en: It was acutely embarrassing for us all.
sentences.cn: 这让我们全体感到非常尴尬。

sentences.en: It was an embarrassing situation, but she managed to laugh it off.
sentences.cn: 那个场面很尴尬,可她一笑摆脱了窘境。

sentences.en: Having lost my money, I was in an embarrassing position.
sentences.cn: 我丟了钱, 处境很窘。

sentences.en: He laughed off the embarrassing situation.
sentences.cn: 他对那尴尬的处境付之一笑。

sentences.en: His jokes didn’t even raise a smile, which was embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 听了他讲的笑话,都没人笑一下,真是太尴尬了。

sentences.en: I found the whole evening intensely embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 我感觉整个晚上让人极度尴尬。

sentences.en: I was in the embarrassing position of having completely forgotten her name.
sentences.cn: 当时我完全忘记了她的名字，很是尴尬。
